definition: usable/workable/feasible/doable/to make/to cause
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: This gave the Chinese people a better sense of balance in regard to this-worldlincss and other- worldliness .
sentences.chinese: 這使得中國人對於入世和出世具有良好的平衡感。

sentences.english: The Rapel Valley weather ripened fruit slowly , and Cabernet Sauvignon developed intense flavours.
sentences.chinese: 蘭佩谷的氣候使得葡萄成熟緩慢，並帶有濃郁的香氣。

sentences.english: I've been as busy as a bee all day doing my spring - cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 大掃除使得我一整天一直忙得不可開交。

sentences.english: Does it make the diaphragm sound (move) different?
What helped the honeyeater elude discovery was it's silent nature.
sentences.chinese: 由於這種食蜜雀的沉默的特性使得它一直沒被發現。

sentences.english: This makes writing document-processing applications much simpler.
sentences.chinese: 這樣使得文檔處理應用程序的編寫更爲簡單。

sentences.english: It took some time to develop a central money-marking business.
sentences.chinese: 這使得建立和發展中央貨幣制造業頗費了一些時間。

sentences.english: Our opposable thumbs, as we call them, allow us to work with our fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我們的對生拇指，使得我們可以使用手指工作。

sentences.english: His guilty conscience forced him to make a clean breast of everything.
sentences.chinese: 他的內疚使得他把一切盡興宣露。

sentences.english: "This project was interesting for manyreasons, "says Mr. Rochon.
sentences.chinese: 很多原因使得這個項目的很有趣，“羅雄先生說。

sentences.english: This makes testing an integral part of the activities associated with this role.
sentences.chinese: 這就使得測試成爲與此角色相關聯活動的主要部分。

sentences.english: This Button Hook makes dressing with one hand easier and quicker.
sentences.chinese: 這使得巴頓胡克敷料用一隻手更加容易和快捷。

sentences.english: That makes it tough for Sisson to cheat, which she says is a "good thing."
sentences.chinese: 這使得西森難有機會作弊，但她認爲這是件好事情。

sentences.english: Opposition politicians blame the government, saying a river project has reduced farmland.
sentences.chinese: 反對黨的政治人物指責政府河川的計劃使得農地減少。

sentences.english: This is why the modern Chinese politics becomes imitative politics.
sentences.chinese: 這使得中國現代政治成了“模仿的政治”。

sentences.english: And make Tianjin caly figurines is to shine is famous of Zhang's Painted caly figurines.
sentences.chinese: 而使得天津泥塑大放異彩的，是“泥人張”的彩塑。

definition: to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
thus/thereby
therefore/as a result/thus/and as a result, ...
thus/consequently/as a result
moreover/in addition to that
due to/as a result of/thanks to/owing to/since/because
and then (what follows next)
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
plus/to put in/to add/to add on/to add into/in addition/on top of that
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to induce/to promote/to urge/to impel/to bring about/to provoke/to drive (sb to do sth)/to catalyze/to actuate/to contribute to (some development)
and/besides/moreover/furthermore/in addition
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
classifier for a ream of paper
see 令狐[Ling2 hu2]
see 脊令[ji2 ling2]
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to cause/to result in
at the same time/simultaneously
